div.p: MILK FOR BABES.
DRAWN Out of the Breaſts of both TESTAMENTS.
Chiefly, for the ſpirituall nouriſhment of Boſton Babes in either England: But may be of like uſe for any Children.
By JOHN COTTON, B. D. and Teacher to the Church of Boſton in New-England.
LONDON, Printed by J. Coe, for Henry Overton, and are to be ſold at his Shop, in Popes-head Alley. 1646. Aprill 9th.

div.head: MILK FOR BABES.
div.p: Q. WHat hath GOD done for you?
A. God hath made me,Pſa. 119.73. Pſ. 128, 4.5, 6, 7, 8. Iſa. 63.1. He keepeth me, and He can ſave me.
Q. Who is God?
A. God is a Spirit ofIob. 4.24 Exo. 3.14 himſelf and for himſelf.
Q. How many Gods be there?
A. There is but one God in three Perſons,1 Cor. 8.6. 1 Ioh. 5.7. the Father, the Sonne, and the Holy Ghoſt.
Q. How did God make you?
A. In my firſt ParentsGen. 1.26, 27. Eccleſ. 7.29. holy and righteous.
Qu. Are you then born holy and righteous?
A. No, my firſt fatherIſ. 43.2 • Ro. 12. • 9 ſinned, and I in him.
Q. Are you then born a ſinner?
A. I was conceived in ſinne, andPſ. 51.5. born in iniquity.
Q. What is your birth-ſinne?
A. ADAMS ſinne imputed to me,Rom. 5.12, 13, 14. Eph, 4, 22 and a corrupt Nature dwelling in me.
Q. What is your corrupt Nature?
Anſw. My corrupt nature is empty ofRom. 7.7.18. Gen. 6.5. Grace, bent unto ſinne, and onely unto ſinne, and that continually.
Q. What is ſinne?
Anſw. Sinne is the1 Ioh. 3.4 tranſgreſſion of the Law.
Qu. How many commandements of the Law be there?
Anſw. Deut. 4.13. (k) Ten.
Q. What is the firſt Commandement?
A. Thou ſhalt have no other Gods butEx. 20.3. me?
Qu. What is the meaning of this commandement?
A. That we ſhouldMat. 4.10. worſhip the onely true God, and no other beſide him.
Q. What is the 2d. Commandement?
Exo, 20.4, 5. A. Thou ſhalt not make to thy ſelf any graven image, &c.
Qu. Wat is the meaning of this Commandement?
Anſ. That we ſhould worſhip theIoh. 4.24 De. 12.32 Mat. 15.9 true God with true worſhip: ſuch as God hath ordained, not ſuch as man hath invented.
Q. What is the third commandement?
A. Thou ſhalt not take the Name of the Lord thy God in vain, &c.
Qu. What is here meant by the Name of God?
A. GodDeut. 28 58. Ex. 33.19 with 34.6. 1 Kin 9.3. Pſa. 138.2 Iob. 1.21. himſelf and the good things of God, whereby he is known, as a man by his name; as his Attributes, worſhip, word, and works.
Qu. What is it not to take his Name in vain?

A. To make uſe of God, and the good things of God, to his glory, and our2 Kings 1.3. Lev. 10.3. Iob. 36.24 1 Cor. 10 31. Iob. 5.27 Deut. 8.16 • er. 2.30. Lev. 26.2. Heb. 4.2. good: not vainly, not unreverently, not unprofitably.
Qu. What is the fourth Commandement?
A. Remember that thou keep holy theExod. 20 8, 9, 10.11 Sabbath day, &c.
Q. What is the meaning of this Commandement?

A. That we ſhould reſt from labor
and much more from play onIſa 58.13.14 Exo. 32.6. the Lords day, that we may draw nigh to God in holy duties.
Queſt. What is the fifth Commandement?
Anſw. Honour thy Father, and thy mother,8 Exod. 20 12. (t) that thy dayes may be long in the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
Queſt. Who are here meant by Father and mother?

Anſw. All our ſuperiours, whether inProv. 23 22. 2 King. 5.13. and 2.12. 1 Cor. 4.15. 2 Chr 29.1 •
• Tim. 5.1 1 Sa. 25.8. Gen 4.20 21. Family, School, Church, and Commonwealth.
Queſt. What is the honour due to them?
Anſw. Reverence,Mal. 1.6 Heb. 12.9. Eph. 6.1. 1 Tim. 5.4. obedience, and (when I am able) Recompence.
Queſt. What is the ſixth Commandement?
Anſw. Thou ſhalt do noExo. 20.13. murther.
Qu. What is the meaning of this Commandement?
Anſw. That we ſhould not ſhorten theMath. 5.22. 2 Cor. 7.10. 1 Sam. 26 24. Mar. 3.4. life, or health of our ſelves or others, but preſerve both.
Queſt. What is the ſeventh Commandement?
Anſw. Thou ſhalt not commitExo. 20.14. Adultery.
Queſt. What is the ſinne here forbidden?
Anſw. To defile our ſelves or othersGen. 38.9.10. Lev. 18.24. with unclean luſts.
Queſt. What is the duty here commanded?
Anſw. Chaſtity, to poſſeſſeTit. 2.5. 1 Pet. 3.2. 1 Theſ. 4.4.5. our veſels in holineſſe and honour.
Queſt. What is the eight Commandement?
Anſw. Thou ſhalt notExod. 20.15. ſteale.
Queſt. What is the ſtealth here forbidden?
Anſw. To take awayLuk. 19.8. 1 The. 4.6. Pro. 21.20. another mans goods, without his leave: or to ſpend our own without benefit to our ſelves or others.
Queſt. What is the duty here commanded?
Anſw. To get our goodsPro. 13.11. Ioh. 6.12. Luk. 19.16. & 15 13. honeſtly, to keepe them ſafely, and to ſpend them thriftily.
Queſt. What is the ninth Commandement?
A. ThouExo. 20 16. ſhalt not bear falſe witneſſe againſt thy Neighbour.
Queſt. What is the ſinne here forbidden?
Anſw. ToEp. 4.25 Ier. 9, 4, 5 Ioſh. 9.22 Prov. 13.7 lye falſly, to think or ſpeak untruly of our ſelves, or others.
Queſt. What is the duty here required?
Ep. 4.25 Mat. 23.23 A. Truth and faithfulneſſe.
Queſt. What is the tenth Commandement?
Ex. •• .17 A. Thou ſhalt not covet, &c.

p.hi: Q. What is the coveting here forbidden?

div.p: Ro. 7.7 Heb. 13.5 Anſw. Luſt after the things of other men: and want of contentment with our own.
Qu. Whether have you kept all theſe Commandements?
Ro. 7.14 and 3.23. Anſw. No, I and all men are ſinners.
Qu. What is the wayes of ſin?
Ro. 6.23 and 2.8, 9 A. Death and damnation.
Queſt. How look you then to be ſaved?
Acts 4.12 Anſw. Onely by Jeſus Chriſt.
Qu. Who is Jeſus Chriſt?
A. The eternall Son of God, who for our ſakes1 Ioh. 5.20. Prov. 8.23 24, 25. Iohn 1.14 2 Cor. 8.9 Lu. 1.68, 69, and 2.11. became man, that he might redeem and ſave us.
Qu. How doth Chriſt redeem and ſave us?
A. By his righteous life, and bitter death, and glorious reſurrection, to lifeGal. 4.4, 5. Math. 20 28. Phi. 2.7, 8 Rom. 4.25 again.
Qu. How do we come to have part and fellowſhip with Chriſt, in his Death and Reſurrection?
A. By the power of hisIoh. 17 20, 21. 2 Co. 5.20 1 Co. 6.17 Word and Spirit, which bring us to Chriſt, and keep us in him.
Qu. What is his Word?
A. The2 Tim. 3 15, 16. Holy Scriptures of the Prophets and Apoſtles, The Old and New Teſtament, Law and Goſpell.
Qu. How doth the Miniſtery of the Law bring you towards Christ?
A. Ro. 3.20 Gal. 3.10 24. Ro. 7.9, 10 By bringing me to know my ſinne, and the wrath of God againſt me for it.
Qu. What are you thereby the nearer to Chriſt?
A. Gal. 3.10 24. So I come to feel my curſed eſtate, and need of a Saviour.
Queſt. How doth the Miniſtery of the Goſpell helpe you in this curſed Estate?
Anſw. By humbling meLuk. 3.4, 5, 6. yet more, and then raiſing me up out of this Eſtate.
Queſt. How doth the miniſtery of the Goſpell humble you more?

Anſw. By revealing the2 Tim. 1.10. 1 Tim. 1.15. Ioh. 16.7.9. & 6.44. Lu. 19.10. grace of the Lord Jeſus, in dying to ſave ſinners: and yet convincing me of my ſinne, in not believing on him, and of mine utter inſufficiency, to come to him; And ſo I feele my ſelfe utterly loſt.
Queſt. How then doth the Miniſtery of the Goſpel raiſe you up out of this loſt eſtate to come unto Chriſt?

Anſw. ByIoh. 12.32. 2 Cor. 5.19.20. Can. 5.10 to 16. with 6.1. 2 Cor. 3.18. Lu. 19.10. Mat. 9.13. Gal. 3.5. Rom. 10.17. with 1.16. teaching me the value and the vertue of the death of Chriſt, and the riches of his grace to loſt ſinners: By revealing the promiſe of grace to ſuch, and by miniſtring the Spirit of grace, to apply Chriſt, and his promiſe of grace unto my ſelfe, and to keepe me in him.

Qu. How doth the ſpirit of Chriſt apply
Chriſt, and his promiſe of grace unto you, and keepe you in him.
Anſw. By begetting in meRom. 10.17. & 10.14. Zach. 12.10. Rom. 16.25.26. 2 Cor. 10.4.5. faith to receive him: Prayer to call upon him: Repentence to mourne after him: and new obedience to ſerve him.
Queſt. What is Faith?
Anſw. Faith is a grace of thePhil 1.29. 2 Cor. 4.13. Phil. 3.8.9. ſpirit; whereby I deny my ſelfe: and believe on Chriſt for righteouſneſſe and ſalvation.
Queſt. What is Prayer?

Anſw. It is a calling uponMat. 6.9. Ioh. 16.23. Rom. 8.26.27. 1 Ioh. 5.14. Acts. 5.31. Zach. 12.10. Eze. 6 9. Iob. 42.6. 2 Sam. 24.10. Levit. 26.40.4. Pro. 28.13. Zach. 12.10. 1 Sam. 7.2 Pſal. 51.1.2 10. God in the Name of Chriſt, by the helpe of the Holy Ghoſt, according to the will of God.
Queſt. What is Repentance?

Anſw. Repentance is a (b) grace of the ſpirit, whereby I loath my ſinnes, and my ſelfe for them, and confeſſe them before the Lord, and mourne after Chriſt for the pardon of them, and for grace to ſerve him in newneſſe of life.
Queſt. What is newneſſe of life or new obedience?

Anſw. Newneſſe of life is aRom. 7.6 1 Pet. 4.2, 3, 4. Pſal. 1 • 6.9. & 119 9.105.115 Pſal. 16.3 grace of the ſpirit, whereby I forſake my
former luſts, and vaine company, and walk before the Lord in the light of his word, and in the Communion of his Saints.
Qu. What is the communion of Saints.
A. It is1 Cor. 1.2. Phil. 1.5. Act. 2.47. Rom. 9.4. 1 Cor. 12.13. the fellowſhip of the Church in the bleſſings of the Covenant of grace, and the ſeales thereof.
Qu. What is the Church?

A. It is a Congregation ofPſal. 89.5. & 50.5.16. Ezek. 20.37. Act 2.42. 1 Cor. 14.23.26. Saints joyned together in the bond of the Covenant, to worſhip the Lord, and to edify one another, in all his Holy Ordinances.
Q. What is the bond of the Covenant, in which the Church is joyned together?
A. It is2 Cor. 8.5. & 9.13. Gen. 17.7 the profeſſion of that Covenant, which God hath made with his faithfull people, to be a God unto them and to their ſeede.
Qu. What doth the Lord binde his people to in this Covenant?

A. ToIoſh. 24.15, 21, 24, 25. 2 Cor. 8.5 Eph. 5.21 Neh. 9.38 vvith 10.28.29 to 34. give up themſelves and their ſeede firſt to the Lord to be his people, and then to the Elders and Brethren of the Church, to ſet forward the worſhip of God and their mutall edifycation.
Q. How do they give up themſelves and their ſeed to the Lord?

A. By receiving throughIoh. 1.12 Gen. 17.9.10. Iſa. 56.6.7. Gen. 18.19. faith, the Lord, & his Covenant, to themſelves; and to their ſeed, And accordingly walking themſelves, and trayning up their Children in the wayes of his Covenant.
Qu. How do they give up themſelves and their ſeed to the Elders and Brethren of the Church?

A. By confeſſion ofMat. 3.6. Act 8.37. 2 Cor. 9.13. Act. 2.38.39. their ſinnes and profeſſion of their faith, and of their ſubjection to the Goſpell of Chriſt. And ſo they and their ſeede are received into the fellowſhip of the Church, and the ſeales thereof.
Qu. What are the ſeales of the Covenant now in the dayes of the Goſpel?
A. Baptiſme (k) and the Lords Supper.
Qu. What is done for you in Baptiſm?

A. In baptiſme,Rom. 4.11. vvith Col. 2.11.12. 1 Cor. 11.25. the waſhing with water is a ſigne and ſeale of my waſhing with the blood and ſpirit of Chriſt, and thereby of my ingrafting into Chriſt: of the pardon and clenſing of my ſinnes: of my riſing up l Heb 10.22. & 12.24. Ioh. 3.5. Rom. 6.2.3. Act. 22.16. Lu. 3.3. 1 Pet. 3.20.21. 1 Cor. 15 29.
out of Affliction: and alſo of my reſurrection from the dead at the laſt day.
Queſt. What is done for you in the Lords Supper?

Anſw. In the Lords Supper the receiving of the bread broken, and and the1 Cor. 10.16. Mat. 26.26 28. 1 Cor. 12, 13. Pſ. 104.15 Ioh. 6.55. wine powred out, is a ſigne and ſeal of my receiving the Communion of the body of Chriſt broken for me, and of his bloud ſhed for me: And thereby of my growth in Chriſt, of the pardon and healing of my ſinnes: of the fellowſhip of his Spirit: of my ſtrengthening and quickning in Grace: and of my ſitting together with Chriſt on his throne of glory at the laſt judgement.
Queſt. What is the reſurrection from the dead, which was ſealed up to you in Baptiſme?
• Ioh. 5.28, 29. Act 24.15 Anſ. WhenLu. 22.27.29, 30. Chriſt ſhall come to his laſt judgement, all that are in the graves ſhall ariſe again, both the juſt and unjuſt.
Queſt. What is the laſt judgement, which is ſealed up to you in the Lords Supper.
A. At the laſt2 Cor. 5.10. Mat. 12.36 1 Cor. 4.5 Ecc. 12.14 day we ſhall all appear before the judgement ſeat of Chriſt, to give an accompt of our works, and to receive our reward according to them.
Qu. What is the reward that ſhall then be given?
Anſ. TheMat. 25.34. Mat. 25.46. righteous ſhall go into life eternall, and the wicked ſhall be caſt into everlaſting fire with the Devill and his angels.
